title: Interdisciplinary Design Thinking Integration Course for Instructional Design Expertise Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental instructional design concepts and basic knowledge in language education
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative learning with digital device support for working professionals with beginner-level language expertise

learning_goals: Learners can derive three methodologies applicable to instructional design processes by analyzing thinking approaches from diverse design fields.
Develop and practice two crossover strategies for language education design through an interdisciplinary approach.
Present a creative design framework that overcomes the limitations of existing instructional design models based on a comprehensive literature analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
